intro: Dendropanax bolivianus, commonly known as the Bolivian arrowleaf, is a climbing shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, arrow-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
